duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the outpatient diabetes self-management program, assess needs, plan content, coordinate, implement, and evaluate specific educational diabetes related to clinical nursing functions and all other educational needs of the facility.
Ensure that all patient care staff is oriented to the standards of care and the nursing scope of practice, policy and procedures, and medical equipment used in routine diabetic patient care.
Act as a facilitator for learning new skills as well as updating current skills related to diabetes.
Communicate with the Administration, Directors/Managers/Charge Nurses, and House Supervisors regarding diabetic educational needs and participate in planning the curriculum.

Demonstrate professional accountability in the acknowledgement of, and compliance with accepted standards of nursing practice as well as a commitment to act within ethical principles; use independent, dependent, and interdependent interventions to fulfill this responsibility.

education_certification.credential: Current and valid state RN License
A minimum of three (3) years experience in an acute care hospital environment.
Excellent clinical, interpersonal, and communication skills essential.
BLS (AHA) certificate upon hire and maintain current.
Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred.
